LOSS OF POWER STEERING WHILE DRIVING, ALMOST CAUSING AN ACCIDENT. I CORRECTED THE POWER STEERING PROBLEM BY TURNING CAR OFF THEN ON A FEW TIMES UNTIL THE IN DASH DISPLAY DID NOT SAY POWER STEERING ANYMORE.  *TR

2006 PONTIAC G6 BASE 4 CYL    HAD STIFF STEERING AND EVENTUALLY LOCKED UP WHILE TURNING GOING 35MPH. HAD TO PULL OVER. RADIO COMPUTER INFORMED ME THAT THE POWER STEREING HAD FAILED. TOOK TO DEALERSHIP WHERE THEY REPLACED THE STEERING MOTOR. 3 MONTHS LATER

MY 2006 PONTIAC G6 GT'S POWER STEERING KEEPS FAILING.  ALL OF A SUDDEN IT WILL STOP WORKING AND THE RADIO WILL SAY POWER STEERING.  GM SHOULD HAVE A RECALL ON THIS PROBLEM.  THERE ARE FORUMS ALL OVER THE INTERNET COMPLAINING ABOUT THIS. *TR

2006 PONTIAC G6, CURRENTLY WITH 76,400 MILES    AT 21K MY BRAKES WERE ALREADY IN THE YELLOW.    AT 38K, I REPLACED THE FRONT BRAKES AND HAD THE CAR ALIGNED.    AT 45K, I HAD TO REPLACE THE FRONT BRAKE PADS AGAIN.    AT 50K, I HAD TO RESURFACE THE ROTORS.

THE REAR BRAKE PADS WORE OUT PREMATURELY AT 30,149 MILES. I CONTACTED THE DEALERSHIP AND WAS TOLD THAT THE BRAKES AREN'T COVERED UNDER WARRANTY, AND THAT THE BACK BRAKES LASTS FOR AROUND 80,00 OR MORE MILES. THEY ALSO TOLD ME THAT THE FRONT PADS WEAR DOWN

MY BRAKES STARTED MAKING A WHINING NOISE THE WEEK OF 11-12-07. I HAD IT LOOKED AT BY THE DEALER ON 11-21-07..THE SERVICE MANAGER ADVISED ME THAT I NEEDED TO REPLACE MY BRAKE PADS AND RECOMMENDED TO HAVE THE ROTORS RESURFACED. MY CAR FIRST CAME OUT IN 2005
